割傷.definition: to gash; to cut; gash; cut

割席.definition: (literary) to break off relations with a friend; to sever ties with sb

割愛.definition: to part with sth cherished; to forsake

割捨.definition: to give up; to part with

割據.definition: to set up an independent regime; to secede; segmentation; division; fragmentation

割棄.definition: to discard; to abandon; to give (sth) up

割肉.definition: to cut some meat; to cut off a piece of flesh; (fig.) (coll.) to sell at a loss

割股療親.definition: to cut flesh from one's thigh to nourish a sick parent (idiom); filial thigh-cutting

割袍斷義.definition: to rip one's robe as a sign of repudiating a sworn brotherhood (idiom); to break all friendly ties

割裂.definition: to cut apart; to sever; to separate; to isolate

割雞焉用牛刀.pinyin: ge1 ji1 yan1 yong4 niu2 dao1
割雞焉用牛刀.definition: lit. why use a pole-ax to slaughter a chicken? (idiom); fig. to waste effort on a trifling matter; also written 殺雞焉用牛刀|杀鸡焉用牛刀[sha1 ji1 yan1 yong4 niu2 dao1]
